indefinite article

a

used before countable or singular nouns referring to people or things that have not already been mentioned

verb

abandon

to leave somebody, especially somebody you are responsible for, with no intention of returning

noun

ability

the fact that somebody/something is able to do something

adjective

able

to have the skill, intelligence, opportunity, etc. needed to do something

adverb

about

a little more or less than; a little before or after

preposition

about

on the subject of somebody/something; in connection with somebody/something

adverb

above

at or to a higher place

preposition

above

at or to a higher place or position than something/somebody

adverb

abroad

in or to a foreign country

adjective

absolute

total and complete

adverb

absolutely

used to emphasize that something is completely true

adjective

academic

connected with education, especially studying in schools and universities

noun

academic

a person who teaches and/or does research at a university or college

verb

accept

to take willingly something that is offered; to say ‘yes’ to an offer, invitation, etc.

adjective

acceptable

agreed or approved of by most people in a society

noun

access

the opportunity or right to use something or to see somebody/something

verb

access

to open a computer file or use a computer system

noun

accident

an unpleasant event, especially in a vehicle, that happens unexpectedly and causes injury or damage

noun

accommodation

a place to live, work or stay in

verb

accompany

to travel or go somewhere with somebody/something

adverb

any

used to emphasize an adjective or adverb in negative sentences or questions, meaning ‘at all’

determiner

any

used with uncountable or plural nouns in negative sentences and questions, after if or whether, and after some verbs

such as prevent, ban, forbid, etc

pronoun

any

used in negative sentences and in questions and after if or whether to refer to an amount or a number,

however large or small

adverb

any more

often used at the end of negative sentences and at the end of questions, to mean ‘any longer’

pronoun

anybody

used instead of somebody in negative sentences and in questions after if/whether, and after verbs such as

prevent, forbid, avoid, etc.

pronoun

anyone

used instead of someone in negative sentences and in questions after if/whether, and after verbs such as

prevent, forbid, avoid, etc.

pronoun

anything

used instead of something in negative sentences and in questions; after if/whether; and after verbs such as

prevent, ban, avoid, etc.

adverb

anyway

adverb

anywhere

pronoun

used to show that something exists or happens

therefore

having a larger distance between opposite sides or surfaces than other similar objects or than normal

a person who steals something from another person or place

adjective

conjunction

conjunction

adverb

where

in or to what place or situation

conjunction

where

conjunction

whereas

used to compare or contrast two facts

conjunction

wherever

in any place

conjunction

whether

used to express a doubt or choice between two possibilities

which

used in questions to ask somebody to be exact about one or more people or things from a limited number

pronoun, determiner

conjunction

while

noun

verb

noun

used in questions to ask about the name, identity or function of one or more people

adjective

living or growing in natural conditions; not kept in a house or on a farm

noun

animals, birds, insects, etc. that are wild and live in a natural environment

noun

the ability to control your thoughts and actions in order to achieve what you want to do; a strong and determined

desire to do something that you want to do

modal verb

will

used for talking about or predicting the future

adjective

not objecting to doing something; having no reason for not doing something

verb

verb

noun

an opening in the wall or roof of a building, car, etc., usually covered with glass, that allows light and air to come

in and people to see out; the glass in a window

wine

an alcoholic drink made from the juice of grapes that has been left to ferment. There are many different kinds of wine.

noun

wing

one of the parts of the body of a bird, insect or bat that it uses for flying

noun

winner

a person, a team, an animal, etc. that wins something
